title: Tip: don't give "bad" champions in nemesis draft, give bad comps
body: Title. It's funny seeing people who think they screwed us by giving us Yorick when we gave them 5 squishies that can't kite well.

Well if they are ranged they can still function with an AD build
Though AD champions with no/bad AP ratios are pretty bad with AP (though there are {{item:3100}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3115}} which kind of gives AP some use)

The easiest way to win is to give the enemy 5 ap burst champs with little hybrid/tank/utility potential, then just have everyone build a couple MR items.  You might think champs like {{champion:55}} and {{champion:7}} are strong, but they offer practically nothing against a team stacking items like {{item:3065}} {{item:3083}} {{item:3102}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3060}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3001}} .  If they can't burst you, they have nothing to fall back on.

Also, it's pretty common that the enemy team will just give you {{champion:3}}, which makes AP burst comps even easier to stomp.

Another thing that's important in Nemesis draft is to never, never, never give the enemy an even somewhat viable adc champ.  Even {{champion:40}} adc is going to make their comp way better.

Until they think outside the box and build tank / AD / support. Yeah I see you mentioned {{champion:40}} at the end, but even {{champion:7}} could ADC with her ranged auto.... It would be interesting.

{{champion:7}} : ranged attack, up to 4 short-CD dashes, 1 (or 2) delayed root(s)...
I actually think she might be a very good ADC whenever all this self-peel would be more meaningful than autoattack steroids.

ADCs are really weak in nemesis draft. Most of them have sub-50% win rates and people like Cait have like 42% win rates. ADCs are great to give in nemesis draft, you just need to make sure you don't give the enemy team any way of supporting that ADC. That's why 5 ADC comps are so easy to beat in this, none of them can do anything to help each other.

A 5 adc comp may be bad, but if they have any 4 non-adcs and you give them an adc to go with it, you have made the enemy comp 100% better.

Also, if you gave them a 5 ADC comp like {{champion:22}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:42}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:236}}, a clever team will make a pretty meta team with Lucian a top laner skirmisher, Graves a jungler bruiser, Ashe a support, Corki a mixed damage mid, and use Draven as the crit-scaling built bot ADC.  Armor pen itemization also scale up much stronger than magic pen items against tanky teams.
